result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Evan Tulgren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:32 a.m. Defendant Matthew Evan Tulgren in court with attorney Mark Biller.  Defendant Matthew Evan Tulgren in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk    Atty Biller addresses the change of attorney's.  He feels it may have been done in error.  DE MTulgren wishes to go forward with Atty Biller.  State does not object to go forward with Atty Biller.  VR complied.  Atty Rennicke argument.  Atty Biller argument.  

SENTENCING:  8 months PCJ  subj GT and WR.  184 Sentence Credit.  Ct finds Time Served.  Amount unpaid reduced to civil judgment.  9:49 adj.
